I see you're using 1.3.1, but just FYI for older JVMs pre-Hotspot (JDK
1.1 and most/all 1.2), run Junit with the -DJAVA_COMPILER=none command
line arg.  That will prevent runtime JIT compilation from obscuring line
number info.

Scott Stirling
Framingham, MA

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Alexander Zynevich [mailto:java@...] 
> 
> You may use compiler with "no-debug-info" settings . Some 
> compilers exclude debug info (VisualAge for example). When 
> using javac and other command line tools ensure that all 
> debug info is included and not excluded with special option.  
> For javac use -g option.
> 
> Hope it helps
> 
> Alexander
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Guerry Semones" <gsemones@...>
> 
> > I've used Junit in past jobs, and do not recall seeing this 
> issue.  I 
> > am running Junit under JDK1.31 on Windows and a Unix platform.  In 
> > either case, when I get a failure's stack trace, I get "unknown 
> > source" for my java code, rather than a line number where one would 
> > expect it.
> >
> > I didn't catch this in the FAQ.  Any ideas what I'm doing wrong?
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Guerry
